name: (512) Brewing Company
description: (512) Brewing is a microbrewery located in the heart of Austin, brewing for the community using as many local, domestic and organic ingredients as possible. We use USDA organic 2-row base malt because it's the right thing to do. We self distribute because we can and we're draft only to keep the product fresh and to reduce disposable packaging. You can taste the passion in our products and we appreciate all our local support.

name: 4 Pines Brewing Company
description:
“Handcrafted beer brewed naturally” means in a nutshell that when you drink our beer you are getting the best of natures goodness.

Drink beer, make it good beer, sip it slowly, so your tastebuds dance in your mouth.

name: 7 Seas Brewing Co
description:
Formed in 2008 by Travis Guterson and Mike Runion, 7 Seas Brewing is an innovative craft brewery, making audacious, yet technically well-executed beers; utilizing cans rather than bottles; and championing environmental stewardship.

Having survived a fire at our original location which delayed our opening by six months, we now occupy a 3,000 square foot brewing facility superbly located in Gig Harbor, Washington.

At 7 Seas Brewing we strive to brew, innovate and perfect the Ultimate Proper Pint, one that will invoke an emotional, contemplative response from the drinker. It should cause them to smile, knowing that in our homogenized, cookie cutter world of consumerism, there are still people crafting something of integrity and authenticity.

locations.name: Main Location
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Wed:  3:00pm - 9:00pm
Thu:  3:00pm - 9:00pm
Fri:  3:00pm - 9:00pm
Sat:  2:00pm - 8:00pm
Sun:  2:00pm - 8:00pm

name: Acadian Farms
description: Nestled in the fertile Carson valley, Acadian Farms is a small family farm and nano-brewery. We believe the old adage, "You are what you eat", so we organically raise our vegetables and animals. We use certified organic barley & malt in our beers and we bake our artisan breads with all natural and/or organic flours from Bob's Red Mill.  Our farmstead cheeses are made with raw milk from grass-fed goats at a local dairy. We invite you out to the farm for a pint and views of the beautiful Columbia River Gorge!

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Thu:  4:00pm - 7:00pm
Fri:  4:00pm - 7:00pm
Sat:  1:00pm - 7:00pm
Sun:  1:00pm - 7:00pm

name: Airdale Brewing Company
description:
Founded in 2008, Airdale Brewing is a craft beer company located in San Diego, California. Founded by a former Naval Aviator and a veteran southern California craft brewer, Airdale strives to create well-balanced, unique, flavorful beers that embody their mantra of, "Work Hard | Play Hard"

Airdale Brewing Co. is working to bring its line of premium craft beers to every market available. We intent to do this by producing quality beers that stand on their own as true examples of artisan american ales.

name: Ambacht Brewing
description:
Ambacht Brewing makes Belgian-inspired ales using local organic ingredients. Our base malt is Great Western Malting's Organic 2-row and our hops come from the Willamette Valley. We bottle condition all our ales with northwestern honey (usually blackberry!).
Ambacht is the Flemish word for hand-crafted and our 5-barrel brewhouse is definitely hands-0n. Stop by for a visit!

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Open daily from Tuesday until Friday from 4 until 8 pm. Saturday and Sunday we will be at Farmers' Markets.

name: Andwells Brewery
description:
Andwell Brewing Company is a true family business, run by Adam Komrower and his wife, Helen.  Andwell’s brewed its first beer in October 2008. Since then, Andwell’s has established a reputation for consistently producing beers of the highest quality

Andwell's run guided Brewery Tours where you can discover some of the secrets of brewing, touch and taste the floor-malted hand-raked barley, take in the sweet aroma of hops and sample some of Hampshire’s finest beers.

name: Aspen Brewing Company
description:
spen’s beer history dates back to 1885 and the original Aspen Brewery which was located only a few hundred yards from the new Aspen Brewery.  Founded by Christian Sanders, the Aspen Brewery operated successfully in Aspen until being purchased by P.H. Zang Company of Denver in 1902.  We believe that they produced one beer, presumable a Lager, to quench the thirst of Aspen’s mining population.

In 1990, Flying Dog brew-pub was opened by George Stranahan and Richard McIntyre in the Cooper Street pedestrian mall.  Locals and visitors flocked to the brew pub for the beer, food and bohemian atmosphere.  Flying Dog operated in downtown Aspen for three years until moving to Denver.

name: Aviator Brewing Company
description:
Aviator Brewing Company was started to provide fine ales and lagers in North Carolina.

We also got sick of driving to the store all the time to buy beer so we thought...what the heck....lets brew lots of beer and drink most of it ourselves.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Thursday & Friday – We open the doors at 5pm, single tour at 6pm and close at 8pm. Note there is only one tour at 6pm.

Saturday – We open the doors at 3pm, and do tours from 4pm-6pm and close at 8pm.  No tours after 6pm.

name: Aztec Brewing Company
description: ABC. Aztec Brewing Company - rediscovered by John Webster in 2008. Aztec Brewery specializes in California Ales and Mexican-style lagers. Come in and learn more about the Aztec Story and the cervezas especiales. aztecbrewery.com blog.californiabeerco.com

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Wed:  4:00pm - 8:00pm
Thu:  4:00pm - 9:00pm
Fri:  4:00pm - 9:00pm

Thu - Fri: 4:00 pm - 9:00 pm

Sun: 1:00 pm - 7:00 pm

name: Bank Beer Company
description: The Bank Beer Company started on a quiet main street in Hendricks, Minnesota a stones throw from the South Dakota Border. We are a brewing company built on the premise that we should give back and leave a legacy bigger than ourselves. With that mission we set out to build a company that devotes its energy to quality beer and giving back a portion of our profits to wildlife land acquisitions and preservation of our history.

name: Bat Creek Brewery
description:
Bat Creek Brewery was established in late 2008. It is owned by Jeremy Gilbert and Ryan and Heather Daffron. We are located in the heart of America at 4 West Main in Bowling Green, Missouri. A wise man once told us that if you aren’t passionate about your job and if you don’t love what you do, get out. We started this brewery because our passion is beer.

Our humble operation is run out of a machine shed. We currently brew less than a barrel at a time, although we will be expanding as soon as we can. We have five year round brews that we are extremely proud to offer. Keep an eye out for new seasonal and limited edition brews as well.

name: Beaver Creek Brewery
description:
Beaver Creek Brewery has become known as a microbrew oasis on the vast plains of eastern Montana. We’re just two minutes off Interstate 94, we always have several hand-made beers on tap, and a song can break out at any time.

Come out and see us in Wibaux, and find out for yourself: Our Beaver Tastes Better!

name: Berwick Brewing
description: Berwick Brewing is dedicated to providing the highest quality, full-flavored, drinkable, Ales & Lagers with only the highest quality ingredients. Our commitment to freshness and character reflects in each glass. With over 50 years combined experience, we understand what our customers seek in quality brewing and world class products.

name: Beta Brewing
description: Established in 2008 by founder, owner, and brewer, K. Kasner as a one man, one barrel operation. We intend to launch our beer in local markets this year (2012) and hope you'll hop on board.

name: Big Al Brewing
description:
To share the passion for brewing and the love of beer that we celebrated as home brewers.

We're proud to offer six year-round beers; a traditional irish red, a chocolatey smoked porter, a session pale ale, dry-hopped IPA, an amber just to pair with pizza and an ESB created to celebrate the passion of our very own Emerald City Supporters.

name: Big Daddy's Brewing Co.
description: We here at Big Daddy's have been pouring our beer since September of 2008, we are fairly new and fresh. The variety of beers we brew here are all unfiltered leaving in all the good stuff most breweries take out, so that means are beers are better for you (HA,HA). Big Daddy's boasts of having a 250 member exclusive mug club so if you want to join you better sign up way in advance. We also have a variety of entertainment at Big Daddy's on the weekends and some weekdays you just need to check the calendar for who's playing and when. We do offer tours of the brewery if you call ahead we can usually fit you in. You can find our beers at the other Awful Arthur's locations. We hope to be in a bar near you in the future and remember to support your local brewery.

locations.name: Main Brewpub
locations.hoursOfOperation: Mon - Fri:	11:00 am - 5:00 pm

name: Birra Toccalmatto
description: Beer Toccalmatto began producing Fidenza in October 2008 with a facility to be cooked to 550 Liters. This is the culmination of a dream of founder Bruno personnel Carillo, who after several managerial experience in the food and beer in particular, has the idea to start producing craft beer. The passion for beer lives of British and Belgian tradition from a project with three other friends, and the beginning of this new adventure.

name: Black Bear Microbrew
description: Black Bear Brewery is Orono’s family owned and operated microbrewery. We pride ourselves in our hand-crafted small-batch beers made using only the highest quality ingredients and the greatest care to bring you the finest quality products. We hope you enjoy them as much as we do.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Wed - Fri: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Blacksmith Brewing
description:
The building that houses Blacksmith Brewing Company was built in 1908.
It began as a steam laundry and later became a Blacksmith shop. With every brand the blacksmith made he would then burn it into the wall to make sure it was perfect. It took a great vision to see what it could become, and a lot of hard work. For seven months we labored, and opened on Oct. 25, 2008. The brands still stand to show testament of all who passed this way.

name: Blind Bat Brewery
description: A one-man, part-time, 3 barrel brewery. The brewery is young, the brewer ain't!

name: Blue Hills Brewery
description:
Beer is our life! Blue Hills Brewery makes great tasting beers inspired by the elements and nature around us; embracing the rich history of the Blue Hills and the South Shore. We do this not only for ourselves but, for our friends, neighbors and visitors to the Boston and South Shore areas. 

We want to grow together with the South Shore community and businesses, by being a good neighbor, demonstrating civic responsibility and producing the finest, freshest beers around. 

Our brew house has a capacity of brewing 20 barrels at a time, that's about 620 gallons per batch. The beer spends the first 7-9 days in a primary fermenting vessel after which it is transferred to a secondary fermenter. There it is chilled to around 40 degrees for another 7-10 days. At this time it is ready to be filtered carbonated and kegged.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Gift Shop:
Mon-Fri 9:00 am - 5:00pm

Tastings: 
Fri:	3:30 pm - 6:30 pm
Sat:	2:00 pm	- 6:00 pm

name: Blue Sky Brewery
description:
Hello and Welcome to Blue Sky Brewery

Thank you for taking the time to view our product and read a little into why our beer brand is unique.

I am proud of what we have accomplished as a team and most importantly how we have taken a regional, obscure brand and thrust it into the upper pantheon of International contemporary beers.Pride, passion, integrity and professionalism are all current corporate buzz words, however I believe in those words and they are why we are an on-going success.

It’s really about a team of people with a common goal. Our team is unique in that they, not only like each other, they actually like working together. Ego is based on the quality of product that they collectively create and deliver on a daily basis. This is why I am proud and why we are attracting so much kudos. People creating a product that is designed for people.

Yes it’s true that our part of the world has some of the cleanest table waters. Yes it is true that our part of the world also has the purest environment for us to deliver a beer that is free of preservatives and additives. Our product is from Cairns and I am proud to say after 20 years of living in Cairns I can give something back to Cairns.

I hope you can spend a few minutes and view our product range.

Thank you.
Benjamin Newman – Chairman

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.streetAddress: Level 2, Cairns Square, Cnr Shields & Abbott St

name: Boatrocker Brewery
description: Boatrocker Brewery are a small, family owned and run microbrewery in Melbourne's south-east. We make world class, international award winning beers, without compromising on the quality of the ingredients. Hopefully you can join us on the journey that is craft beer.

name: Bootlegger's Brewery
description: Bootlegger's Brewery is a local microbrewery located in Fullerton, California. We are a small artisian brewery established with the mission of providing fresh and unique craft beer to the local community and beyond. Our unique small batch process makes us one of the most flexible breweries in Southern California. We pride ourselves on our ability to deliver a wide variety of styles and flavors in our beer with the highest level of quality.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Thu:  4:00pm - 9:00pm
Fri:  4:00pm - 9:00pm
Sat:  2:00pm - 9:00pm

Thursdays 4-9 pm
Fridays from 4-9 pm
Saturdays 2-9 pm.

name: Brasserie artisanale Le Bien, le Malt
Brasseur de Montreal
description:
rasseur de Montréal (BdM) opened its doors on March 7, 2008, in the historic Montréal neighbourhood of Griffintown, located at 1483, Ottawa Street, just east of Guy.

BdM is the brainchild of Marc-André Gauvreau and Denise Mérineau, who pooled their expertise to found one of the most prominent industrial microbreweries in the Greater Montréal Area.

Only steps from the downtown area, the Bell Centre and the Champlain and Victoria bridges, BdM is able to serve clients throughout Quebec thanks to its various distribution networks.

BdM makes 7 beers that are offered year-round as well as a number of specialty seasonal beers. All are served in BdM’s excellent resto-bar adjacent to the brewing facilities, where clients can watch the beer-making process while enjoying a delicious home-style meal.

locations.name: Resto-bar
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Monday to Friday
from 11:30 a.m., lunch and supper

Saturdays and Sundays
from 3:00 p.m.

name: Brew Rebellion
description:
Andy and Brad have been home brewing for years together and through trial and error have come up with some amazing and tasty brew concoctions. Special recipes like “White Chocolate Raspberry Stout” or the cinnamon and cloves party in your mouth seasonal winter warmer recipe called, “Peace on Earth” or the sitting around the campfire approved S’mores Porter or what about the fruit and honey light taste of “Peach Honey Wheat”.

Brad and Andy have known Ed for some time and the boys knew that an old fart like Ed with a business background made him a good candidate to help them put together a business and marketing plan. Since Ed is a big fan of craft beer, he said, why not? “Let’s build a brewery”.

Brew Rebellion was born.

name: Brouwerij De Leite
description: Brewing since 1997.  Officially transformed in 'brewery De Leite in 2008.  started with a brewingkettle of 8,5 HL.  now ( 2011) expanding to a brewing kettle of 60 HL.  Only brewing once a month.

name: Brouwerij De Vlier
description:
A very small brewery who brews amazing good beers.
They brew blond, triple and brown beer and they brew a uniek appatiser-beer

name: Buckbean Brewing Company
description:
Buckbean Brewing Company — the first package brewery in Western Nevada and the second of three in the Silver State — began operations in a new 7,600-square-foot facility in Reno, NV in April 2008. Buckbean Brewing Company debuted with two styles of beer in 16 oz. cans, which has now grown to three, but also offers different styles on tap. The brewery houses a tasting room and offers guided tours free of charge.

Buckbean Brewing Company is the vision of Reno native Douglas S. Booth and Veteran brewmaster Daniel B. Kahn. These two self described “beer junkies” joined up in 2004 to create a new kind of microbrew appealing to both male and female beer drinkers.

name: Bull & Bones Brewhaus & Grill
description: Bull & Bones is a brewpub with both an upscale dining room and a separate sports bar with a casual dining area. Currently offering 7 craft beers brewed on site in our 10 barrel brewhaus. We have a wood-fired grill, on-site smoker, an ice rail integrated into our granite bar, 20 HDTV's, and 7 championship pool tables!

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun:	11:00 am	-	2:00 am

name: Cavalry Brewing
description: Cavalry Brewing beers are brewed using traditional English methods on American equipment to create fresh and flavorful ales and stouts to entice the most discerning palate. Each product is a balance between the barley and the hops to provide an easy drinking ale or stout.

name: Cellar Rats Brewery
description: We are Ohio's first Winery / Brewery combination. We are built into the Debonne Vineyards Winery in Madison. Cellar Rats is a handcrafted micro brewery located in Madison, Ohio at the Debonné Winery. Our goal is to bring you world class, hand crafted beers with our brewers special twist.

name: Chuckanut Brewery & Kitchen
description: Enjoy world class European style, award winning lagers & ales and a local-centric menu of fresh American cuisine including woodstone pizzas, burgers, seafood, salads and more! All ages are welcome everyday starting at lunch and into the night.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Sunday - Thursday
Food Service 11:30 - 9:00pm 
Bar Open Late

Friday and Saturday
Food Service 11:30 - 10:00pm
Bar Open Late

name: Cigar City Brewing
description: Cigar City Brewing was founded with two goals in mind. The first to make the world's best beer and the second to share with people near and far the fascinating culture and heritage of the Cigar City of Tampa. From its past as the world's largest cigar producer to its Latin roots and the many other diverse peoples that call it home, Tampa draws on many sources to develop its unique culture. At CCB we are fascinated by Tampa's history and suspect you will be too.

Sunday – Thursday: 11am – 10pm
Friday & Saturday: 11am – 11pm
Brunch: Saturday & Sunday: 11am – 3pm

name: COOP Ale Works
description:
COOP Ale Works began with a humble home brewer and a simple dream. The idea spread as friends tasted the unique beers, and the popularity of those early batches encouraged a dedicated team of three partners to begin working to make the dream of a local brewery a reality. Mark Seibold, JD Merryweather and Daniel Mercer spent the next two years traveling throughout the United States, Europe and Central America visiting breweries and sampling local flavors. The insight gained from entrepreneurs, brewers, biologists, operations personnel and consumers provided an invaluable basis for a serious endeavor into quality commercial brewing. By integrating this knowledge with the local, regional and national brewing trends, as well as local feedback, the trio planned the birth and growth of the yet unnamed COOP. After nearly 3 years of research, comprising thousands of man hours and dozens of test batches, COOP fashioned its identity as a steadfast professional team that holds closely a passion for bringing quality, local beer to taps and homes in Oklahoma City and beyond.

 

With the help of close friends and fellow craft-beer fans, COOP was capitalized on July 15th, 2008. In less than 6 months, the COOP team; navigated the multi-layered regulatory process, secured a building lease, completed the remodel, purchased and installed a commercial brewery, obtained brewing licenses from the State of Oklahoma and the Federal Tax and Trade Bureau, created and branded original recipe beers and brewed the first full scale batches for distribution.

The outpouring of support that has come from friends of the COOP team has been overwhelming. Our sincere hope is that you – the fan of COOP Ale Works – will take pride in the beers, as if they were your own. Thank you for your unwavering support and encouragement!

name: Cosmic Ales
description:
Brewing a truly cosmic beer.
We are committed to brewing true flavors of beer that satisfy every taste bud.

name: Craft Brew Alliance, Inc.
description:
Craft Brew Alliance was formed with the merger of leading Pacific Northwest craft brewers – Widmer Brothers Brewing and Redhook Ale Brewery – in 2008. With an eye toward preserving and growing one-of-a-kind craft beers and brands, CBA was joined by Kona Brewing Company in 2010.
When Kurt & Rob Widmer founded Widmer Brothers Brewing in 1984, they didn’t confine their brewing exploration to strict style guidelines. To this day, Widmer Brothers continues to create handcrafted beers with a unique and unconventional twist on traditional styles that are award winning and please a wide range of craft beer lovers.

Redhook began in a Seattle transmission shop in 1981, and those colorful roots are reflected in the brand’s personality to this day. As one of the country’s first craft breweries, Redhook continues to offer sessionable craft beers to consumers across the country.

Kona Brewing was founded in 1994 by the father and son team of Cameron Healy and Spoon Khalsa, who dreamed of crafting fresh, local island brews with spirit, passion and quality. As the largest craft brewery in Hawaii, Kona personifies the laid-back, passionate lifestyle and environmental respect of the people and culture of Hawaii.

name: Crispin Cider
description:
Classically refined, but not styled as a traditional "sweet beer" beer alternative, Crispin ciders are crisp and clean, not sweet and sticky and never sacrifice superior quality refreshment satisfaction for overbearing complexity.

Always true to the apple, Crispin Hard Ciders naturally fermented in the USA use fresh pressed apple-juice, not from apple juice concentrate, from a premium blend of US West Coast apples, with no added malt, grape wine or spirit alcohol. Crispin’s unique USA produced ciders are smoothed with pure apple juice or from natural sugar sources like organic honey or organic maple syrup, and contain no added colorants, sorbate or benzoate preservatives.

Crispin ciders have 7 different varietals - Original, Light and Brut; classic European styled crisp clean ciders, Browns Lane; an imported classic English dry cider, and our line of Artisanal Reserves; Honey Crisp, The Saint and Lansdowne - unfiltered "cloudy" ciders, ground-breaking "craft beer" uniquely American ciders.

Crispin ciders are all Gluten Free for the wheat-intolerant person.

name: Crown Brewing
description:
When the Crown Brewing Company opened its doors in 2008 we had one goal in mind, "Craft the Best Beer Period!" In 2010 our Industrial Porter won a Bronze Medal in the World Beer Cup, Brown Porter category.

We offer a selection of six to eight of our hand-crafted beers, fresh and on tap year round. In addition to our foundation beers, we brew special seasonal beers throughout the year. So, stop on in and see what's new!

name: Crown Valley Brewing & Distilling Company
description: Crown Valley Brewing & Distilling features handcrafted brews made exclusively at the Coffman location by Brewmaster, Jeremy Gilbert. All beers are produced in the state-of-the-art 15-barrel microbrewery.  We strive to produce small batches of great beer.

name: Devils Backbone Brewing Company
description: 2012 GREAT AMERICAN BEER FESTIVAL SMALL BREWPUB and SMALL BREWPUB BREWER OF THE YEAR & 2010 WORLD BEER CUP CHAMPION BREWERY & SMALL BREWPUB, the award winning Basecamp Brewpub is situated in the majestic valley of the Blue Ridge Mountains with a lodge style atmosphere. We brew authentic craft beer in our brewhouse with a traditional German style brewing system and pour fresh brews daily from 16 taps in the pub area. Our menu specializes in oak wood -fired smoked dishes and local fare. We offer children their own special menu too!  Basecamp is open daily: 11:30pm serving lunch & dinner.

locations.name: Devils Backbone Brewing Company - Outpost
locations.hoursOfOperation: Wednesday & Thursday open 1pm - 7pm.  Friday & Saturday open 1pm - 8pm.  Sunday open 1pm - 6pm

name: Doodle Brewing Company
description:
The Doodle Brewing Company was started by Nick Vaughn in 2008. Nick graduated from the University of Missouri-Columbia with a degree in Chemical Engineering. After graduation, Nick got a call from the Harpoon Brewery in Boston and they were willing to give him a shot. While he was working out east, he enjoyed the superb beer culture and variety of beers available in New England. But he knew that he would one day return to Missouri. Finally, after three years, probably too many beers, and the addition of his son, Nick finally got his chance to come back to Missouri. He worked at a small brewpub in Kansas City called The 75th Street Brewery where he was able to experiment with many different beer styles and brewing techniques. Again after a few years, Nick grew restless. While working at a brewpub was fun and enjoyable, it just had too many other distractions from his true passions... Brewing beer, drinking beer and spreading the word about craft beer.
So he started the Doodle Brewing Company with every intention of brewing beers and beer styles that explore the boundries of flavor. He's probably sitting in front of his brewhouse right now with a beer enjoying what he's doing because he's making beer for you.

name: Driftwood Brewery
description: We love great beer, in fact we live it! We are a crew of seven, working hard to brew the beers we love. At Driftwood we're doing our best to expand the landscape of quality beer in British Columbia.

name: Eastern Shore Brewing Co
description:
Eastern Shore Brewing opened it's doors September of 2008 by owners Adrian and Lori Moritz.  Both had an entrepanerial passion, but never thought of a microbrewery as their business.  "The decision was made for us.  Make a business out of something you love to do and you will never work another day in your life" the couple states.  A lot of hard work and a love for good beer motivates the business. 
We decided to open Eastern Shore Brewing after talking with friends from St. Michael's Winery, and were told that the town was in need of a microbrewery.  After some discussion (less than you may think), we agreed and were on our way.  With some trials along the way in year one, year two proved to be the pinicle of change.  An increase in brewery size promoted an increase of staff.  Randall Marquis came on board as brewmaster in March of 2009 and has made his presence known.  An undergratudate of Franklin Marshall College, and a brewing certificate holder from UC Davis, Randy is a large portion of the success of Eastern Shore Brewing.  Three beers took home medals in the Maryland Govenor's cup competition (Bronze for Lighthause Golden Ale, Silver for the Duck Duck Goose Porter and a Silver for the St.ichael's Amber ALe) on October 9th.  And although happy with the medals, Eastern Shore Brewing's goals are to continue to grow the busines and improve their products.  Distribution ranges from Cambridge to Kent Island on the Eastern Shore of Maryland, and recently moved into Ellicott City, Maryland.  A new fermenter will be arriving shortly after the new year, which will increase capacity even further.
There is more to come....

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Monday - Friday 12 till 5 PM
Saturday 12 till 7 PM
Sunday 12 till 5 PM

name: EPIC Brewing Company
description:
EPIC Brewing Company opened in May 2010 with six fermentation tanks, but an increase in space and brewing capacity has given brewers the flexibility to create beers that have yet to be imagined. Epic has doubled is capacity twice in the past three years and in the summer of 2013 opened an additional brewery in Denver, CO.  

In only a few short months after opening, Epic began earning medals for its beers domestically and internationally. Now brewing over 35 distinctly different beers we believe there is an Epic brew for your tastes, at the right place and the right time. At Epic, everyone is here to help you make the perfect beer match.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm
Fri - Sat: 10:00 am - 11:00 pm

locations.name: Taproom & Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: The taproom hours are Monday through Thursday, 12:00 pm – 9:00 pm, Friday and Saturday, 12:00 pm – 10:00 pm and Sunday from 11:00 am – 8:00 pm. Brewery tours are held Thursday and Friday at 3:30pm and Saturday and Sunday at 12:00, 2:00, 4:00 and 6:00.

name: Fenton Winery & Brewery
description: The Fenton Winery & Brewery just relocated to a new, beautiful, 5 acre property in Fenton Township. At over 1 acre, the beer garden is one (if not the) largest in the state. The taproom is located right alongside the brewery and is around the corner from the winery - all in full view of patrons. The FWB specializes in crafting balanced wines and beers that maximize flavor and originality. Food is available - from tasty specialty meat & cheese plates, to    delicious sandwiches and specialty pizzas. Definitely worth a stop (or three). Cheers!

name: Fremont Brewing
description:
Fremont Brewing was born of our love for our home and history as well as the desire to prove that beer made with the finest local ingredients – organic when possible --, is not the wave of the future but the doorway to beer's history. Starting a brewery in the midst of the Great Recession is clearly an act of passion. We invite you to come along with us and enjoy that passion -- because beer matters.

Known as the Center of the Universe, Fremont is industrial and sleekly postmodern -- home to artists, fisherpeople, tradespeople, technology geeks, and lots of beer lovers. And, for those who don't know, Washington state is home to the second largest hop growing region in the world.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Monday - Wednesday: 11:00 - 5:00pm
Thursday: 11:00 - 8:00pm
Friday: 11:00 - 8:00pm
Saturday:   Noon - 8:00pm
Sunday: Noon - 5:00pm

name: Ghost River Brewing
description:
In 1887, Memphis first tapped the now famous Memphis Sands Aquifer. Recharged by the Ghost River's fragile wetlands, the aquifer has supplied Memphis with a steady and consistent supply of excellent drinking water ever since.

Ghost River Brewing knows that "great water makes great beer." And some of the greatest drinking water on earth is available right here in west Tennessee.

Brewing locally guarantees that every handcrafted, full-flavored Ghost River Ale is the freshest beer available . . . and when it comes to flavor, freshness means everything!

Ghost River Brewing supports the Wolf River Conservancy by donating a portion of the proceeds of every barrel sold.

Help Ghost River Brewing and the Wolf River Conservancy protect our local, natural resources and the quality of our famous drinking water

name: Great Crescent Brewery
description:
The Great Crescent Brewery beers are made with all malt, fresh hops and whole ingredients. Every beer is hand-crafted in small batches using traditional brewing methods. We package our beer in self-pressurizing mini-kegs that hold the equivalent of a case of beer, half–gallon refillable growler bottles and 1/6 barrel (5 gallon) kegs that can be used in commercial and home draft systems. Some of our specialty beers, like our Cherry Ale, will only be available in limited quantities.
We are a production brewery that sells beer right from the premises. Although we don’t currently have a tasting room where we can sell beer by the glass – we will be offering samples to help you decide which beer to purchase.

We are open to the public Wednesday-Friday 2pm to 7pm, Saturday 12 (noon) to 7pm and Sunday 12 (noon) to 4pm. You can purchase our beers outside of the brewery at The Pour House in Aurora, Indiana, Bakers Discount Liquors in Rising Sun, Indiana and Whitey’s in Lawrenceburg, Indiana. We are also available on draft at Bourbons Bar & Grill in Lawrenceburg, Indiana.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Friday 1PM to 6PM
Saturday Noon to 6PM
Closed Sunday through Thursday

name: Hangar 24 Craft Brewery
description: Hangar 24 Craft Brewery began with a true passion for good beer, the absolute love of flying and the pure enjoyment of being around great friends. Founder and Master Brewer Ben Cook and his buddies used to meet at hangar 24 after an afternoon of flying to trade stories, talk aviation, play music and share a few cold ones that Ben just finished brewing at home. These days, the location of where these fine beers are brewed has changed, but the quality time spent enjoying a delicious, handcrafted beer and conversation with friends is the same as ever. Cheers.

name: Hawthorn Brewing Co
description:
In the days of old, travelling merchants criss-crossed the globe, journeying to exotic lands in search of the finest treasures. Following in this bold tradition are the Flavour Merchants of the Hawthorn Brewing Co. From their base in Hawthorn, these intrepid explorers scour the beer world, risking life and limb to bring home the secrets of its best brewers. It is only by trialling and refining these techniques that we are able to create award winning beers of distinction including our Premium Pale Ale, Amber Ale, Pilsner and Witbier.
Yes.. It’s a tough job, but someone has to do it.

name: Holy Brew Brewing Company
description:
The inner battle of good and evil was never more apparent than when one takes that first cleansing sip of HolyBrew. While your "good" nature will definitely be aroused by this cool, spirit-raising refreshment, your inner evil will soon begin to feel less inhibited, allowing initial laughter and fun to soon require an internal battle of self-restraint.

History - Since the dawn of mankind, we have struggled with the battle of good and evil. To drown in guilt or sorrow is unhealthy and seen by some as wasted emotions. In opposition, to live our lives completely without impure influence and to be seen by all as “up-tight” without the ability to cut loose on occasion is viewed in equally a negative fashion. Until now, there has never been a respectable or enjoyable solution to this life long struggle.
HolyBrew is a positive channel for cleansing one’s mind, body and spirit of unwanted or unnecessary guilt, doubt or unhappiness. Through a recently discovered magical formula, believed to be created from the gods themselves, HolyBrew has formulated the “Liquid Confession”. What better way to cleanse one’s soul than to partake of this succulent brew, confess one’s sins and erroneous ways and let the weight of their guilt be lifted and their thirst quenched simultaneously.
Join the movement in guilt-free pleasure and refreshment. Have your liquid confession today and enjoy life to its fullest.

locations.name: Golden
locations.hoursOfOperation: 11am to 11pm daily

locations.name: Matthews
locations.hoursOfOperation: 11am - 11pm daily

locations.name: Littleton
locations.hoursOfOperation: 11am to 11pm daily

locations.name: Alexandria
locations.hoursOfOperation: 11am to 11pm daily

name: Hopworks Urban Brewery
description: HUB is Portland's first Eco-Brewpub to offer all organic handcrafted beers, fresh local ingredients, and a sustainable building with a relaxed and casual atmosphere. Brewmaster Christian Ettinger has spent the past year and half constructing his dream brewpub.  HUB incorporates all aspects of sustainability.  From composting to rain barrels, and from pervious pavers to hand dryers, we have made every effort to protect our future with a thoughtful alternative.  Hopworks has four distinct areas including a family friendly restaurant with play area, a vibrant bicycle bar, banquet mezzanine, and outdoor beer-garden.  Our 20 barrel brewery produces 3000 barrels a year and provides our restaurant with ten different HUB organic beers on tap and two cask ales at all times. We have parking for seventy cars, eight motorcycles and up to fifty bikes.  Our world-class beer, New York style pizza, and wonderful staff are some of the best you will find anywhere.

name: Indigo Imp Brewery
description: The Indigo Imp Brewery is an independent, family-owned and operated microbrewery hand-crafting small batches of the highest quality Real Ales. All beers are produced in open fermentors. These beers are various classic styles as well as some new creations.

name: Intercourse Brewing Company
description:
"May your spirit be light and may you always enjoy Intercourse."

Affectionately named for the town in Lancaster County, PA Intercourse Brewing Company began production in June 2008.

name: Jailhouse Brewing Company
description: Some often tell me that the old Hampton Jailhouse was the overnight home to many a drunken guest through the years. It seems only fitting that beer is being brewed in this quaint little two-story brick structure built in the 1920's. It's had its history as the jail, fire station, courthouse, mason lodge, and last but not least a sandwich shop that made those little sandwiches you can buy in gas stations. You know the triangle packaged ones that have mystery meat in them? Don't lie, you've had one. Today it is home to JailHouse Brewing Company and we are brewing hand-crafted beer not punching out license plates.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Saturday's 2-6pm

name: Joseph James Brewing Co. Inc.
description: Southern Nevada Craft Brewery Specializing in Craft Beer and Gluten Free Ales

name: Kind Beer Distributing
description: The first offering from Kind Beers hit store shelves and restuarants in the Charlotte, North Carolina market in the summer of 2008. Since the introduction, our beers have made their way into establishments all over the Southeastern United States.

name: Kooinda Boutique Brewery
description:
Kooinda, meaning ‘ Happy Place’, is an award winning boutique brewery producing handcrafted, quality Australian made ales.

Kooinda brewed ales are unfiltered and use only the finest available malted barley, hops, water and yeast.

name: Lawson's Finest Liquids
description: Lawson’s Finest Liquids, LLC is based in Warren, Vermont and distributes small, custom batches of unique beer through their exclusive wholesale distributor, The Beer Guy, LLC. Sean Lawson, founder and brewer, has been an avid home brewer for nearly twenty years, with numerous award winning recipes. Lawson’s Finest, with a small batch system, can custom craft specialty beers for establishments and events. Limited in availability by design, these rare beers can only be found near the Mad River Valley of Vermont.

name: Liberty Street Brewing Company
description:
Liberty Street Brewing Company began in concept back in 2006, and finally became a reality in the fall of 2008.  We provide an elegant atmosphere where people can enjoy a fine, hand crafted beer in Plymouth, Michigan’s historic Old Village.

Our focus is to provide a large assortment of crafted, small batch ales and lagers through an exceptionally service oriented waitstaff.  We also offer a short list of regularly available food items during all hours of operation, and have special food items to be served during happy hour, weekends and special occasions.  Several local restaurants  deliver other fresh meals right to your table – just ask us for their carry-out menus.

The Upper Hall at the brewery can be reserved for private parties for up to 70 people.  It is a large area with separate restroom facilities, and a small service bar.  The Upper Hall has a sound and video system that can be used for business presentations, home movies, etc.  Inquire for details.

name: Lift Bridge Brewery
description: Welcome to Lift Bridge Beer Company. Our mission is simple: to create fine beers for you to enjoy! It is our pleasure to supply you with what you need to help you slow down and enjoy life. Whether that is a Farm Girl Saison®, Crosscut Pale Ale™, an American Pale Ale or any of our other seasonal specialties, we want to brew it our way! We hope that through every bottle and tap pull, you can taste: the history of our City, the pride and fun we have in its creation, the uncompromising natural ingredients and brewing process utilized, and ultimately our sincere hope that we have given an experience that makes you proud to be a beer drinker.

name: Lucky Bucket Brewing Company
description:
After years of working a local brewpub and experimenting in the garage, three guys decided to take their know-how and passion for great beer and bottle it.

Lucky Bucket Brewing Company is Nebraska's newest craft brewery, growing almost as fast as we can brew it. Our first release, Pre-Prohibition style Lager, is getting some welcomed praise for representing the true character of beer, reminiscent of a time when beer actually had flavor. Keep an eye out for our latest releases including a very floral and flavorful American IPA and our first barrel-aged release, Certified Evil.

name: Marble Brewery
description: Marble Brewery is located in the heart of Downtown Albuquerque.  Marble is a hub for local lovers of craft beer, community, music, food, and fun.  We offer bold, award-winning, locally brewed craft beer in a lively pub setting.

locations.name: Marble Brewery Westside Taproom
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon-Th 2:00 PM – 11:00 PM
Fri & Sat 12:00 PM – 11:00 PM
Sun 12:00 PM – 10:00 PM

name: McLaren Vale Beer Company
description:
McLaren Vale Beer Company was founded by a couple of Craft Beer loving, proud South Australian mates, who enjoyed decades of heading down to the Vale from Adelaide for summer holidays and long weekends. Being lovers of great food and beverage and local produce, the rich tapestry of McLaren Vale always delivered. As the boys got to know the wine community and gained a deeper understanding of the region, they realised there was a tremendous opportunity for a beer producer to add another dimension to the local offering. Beer has long been a popular post-work refreshment for the wine community and we like to think that behind every great wine is great beer.
Us South Aussies are spoilt for choice when it comes to great food, beverage and produce. We have an appreciation for the good things in life, having grown up with such quality at our fingertips. This is the reason we started a beer company in this great state. We feel at home here and with that comes a responsibility to play a part in the great food and beverage offering.

name: Moscow Brewing Company
description: Moscow Brewing Company entered the Russian beverage market with products of own production in September 2008. The company consists of the most modern brewery in Russia, as well as its own distribution and logistics centers located three kilometers from the Moscow Ring Road (in Mytischi) in an ecologically clean area. Partners of the project and Sberbank of Russia Investment Fund Detroit Investments, total investment amounted to over $ 300 million.

name: Mother Earth Brew Company
description:
In early 2010, Mother Earth launched a unique brewing supply store and tasting room at its new Vista, CA location. Just a half mile from the 78 freeway and just minutes from the I-5, Mother Earth Brew Co. is right in the middle of the "North County Beer Triangle" in North San Diego County. 

Our business caters to home brewers seeking the highest quality, freshest ingredients and to people who enjoy sampling great beers - many of which are exclusively available at our tasting bar! Come on by for a truly unique experience, and always remember...Love Your Mother!

locations.name: Main Brewery

Retail Store

Mon: Closed
Tues: Closed

Tasting Room
Sun: 12pm to 5pm
Mon: Closed
Tues: Closed
Wed: Closed
Thurs: 4pm to 8pm
Fri: 4pm to 8pm
Sat: 12pm to 5pm

name: Naked City Brewery & Taphouse
description:
Once upon a time, there were two dudes named Donald and Don. One was an engineer toiling away on the super computers of a local university, and the other was a supervisor managing the complex operations of a local billionaire. Both of them loved their jobs, but more than their jobs they loved beer. Each Don had a recurring dream of a magical place without a name, a place where the great beers of the world flowed like the Salmon le Sac at flood stage, and the fine brewing tradition of the Pacific Northwest stood proudly beside the best concoctions from far-flung breweries in Asia and across Europe.

Don and Donald worked tirelessly in the wee hours on their home brew mixtures, searching for the best possible combination of hops, malt, barley, and love. For long years, the two Dons had their separate dreams, and never met. A local poet named Bryan had the pleasure of growing up with Donald, and worked for the same local billionaire as Don. After many months of hearing Don speak of his dream of the magical beer haven, Bryan knew it must be the very same place of which Donald had spoken too. He knew instinctively that it was his responsibility to bring the two Dons together. On a fateful summer afternoon at the Elysian Brewery on Capitol Hill, the two Dons met. The event later became known as THE HAPPY HOUR OF DESTINY.

Every patron in the pub knew something special was happening that day. The magical place both men dreamed of was one and the same. That very afternoon, the two Dons vowed to create a great beer haven right here on earth, and together they would name this magic place THE NAKED CITY. In THE NAKED CITY, it doesn't matter where you're going or where you've been, all that matters is great living and great beer. In THE NAKED CITY, the only problem is what great craft beer to try next. The two Dons spent a combined 25 years studying the world's great brewing traditions, and couldn't wait to begin experimenting together. Their very first batch of beer, an Oak-aged double IPA, took a ribbon in the Northwest regionals of the 2007 National Homebrew Competition. The rest, as they say, is history.

Two years after the two Dons combined their separate dreams, THE NAKED CITY opened its doors. Now Naked City boasts an award-winning brewery that produces a variety of small-batch beers available at the pub and friendly bars and restaurants in Seattle, Tacoma, Bellingham, and beyond. The 24 taps of THE NAKED CITY offer a constantly rotating variety of Washington's best beers, regional craft beers, and the best beers Donald and Don have found in two lifetimes of beer travels around the world.

Two and a half years after THE NAKED CITY was founded, the Dons convinced the local poet who brought them together to join them in the adventure. The Dons and Bryan together built a bigger brewery; a full-size kitchen; a dining room/movie theatre called The Screening Room that features free monthly events including film, comedy, poetry, community discusssion, and jazz; and now The Walrus Beer Garden, a patio that's home to murals by local artists, games, and summertime events.

So. Welcome to THE NAKED CITY, where great beer lovers flock like the salmon of Capistrano, and the only question is: WHAT TAP NEXT?

name: Napa Smith Brewery
description: We create our beers using proprietary recipes developed by our Master Brewer Don Barkley, with his 30+ years in the craft brewing industry. Only the finest domestic and European hops, two row barley, and malted wheat are used in the beer that we make

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sun: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm

name: New Planet Beer Company
description:
New Planet Beer specializes in great tasting craft ales, that are 100%gluten-free, offering a range of beer styles that can be enjoyed by any craft beer drinker, but especially by those that gluten-free is their only option. Unrivaled in flavor, quality, taste and care, New Planet is everything a craft beer should be.

The brand is grounded on what’s good for the earth and for the individual, and is about discovering something better. That’s why New Planet is dedicated to donating a portion of their proceeds to help make the planet better for all of us.

name: Nola Brewing Company
description: NOLA Brewing – New Orleans Lager & Ale – represents the creation of refreshing high-quality beer in the heart of New Orleans. Located in the Irish Channel, we provide locally produced products and are sensitive to the taste, look, and feel of great beer. Founded in 2008 by Kirk Coco & Peter Caddoo, NOLA Brewing is providing quality lagers and ales for you to enjoy. Check out our current selections and locations proudly serving our fine ales and go enjoy one!

name: Off Color Brewing
description:
We make beer. Sometimes we do other things but not as well.

We've produced award winning, beers on the global stage. Now we just do it for ourselves applying our brewing knowledge, experience, and creativity to create a new breed of classically inspired American beer.

name: Old Forge Brewing Company
description:
Old Forge Brewing Company is a fun, casual, comfortable brewpub, specializing in healthy pub fare and fresh brewed beer.

Our country was built on the skills and labor of old-world artisanal craftsmen. Woodworkers, carpenters, stonemasons, ironworkers, blacksmiths, tileworkers, and many others came here and employed the knowledge and skills of their craft in building their farms, homes, and towns.

Nowadays, it is so easy and convenient to purchase generic products from big-box stores, that we sometimes neglect to appreciate the uniqueness and quality of a hand-crafted product.

At Old Forge Brewing Company, we strive to honor personal craftsmanship. Our hand-crafted beer is made in small batches to ensure quality and peak freshness, while the healthy and delicious menu has ingredients sourced from local farms and markets wherever possible. Take the time to notice our bar, furniture, and fixtures which were all handcrafted by local wood and metal worker Keith Kocher (Lightstreet Custom Woodworking). Check out our unique tap handles carved and forged by local artist/sculptor J. Mark Irwin (Irwin Sculpture Studio), and our plates, bowls, and beer mugs, all hand-made by local potter Mike Hart (M. Hart Pottery).

name: Pretty Things Beer & Ale Project
description:
We are a gypsy brewery, without a permanent brewing home. We like it that way, we can be whatever we want to be on a shoestring budget. What more do you want than that?

Our flagship beer is Jack D'Or. Jack is the mournful grain of barley you can see to the right. He is the soul of beer, nature's magician, creating sugar from starch and bringing together the Pretty Things to produce the substance we adore: beer.

name: Prison Brews
description: Prison Brews is a unique brewpub located in the historic east side of Jefferson City two blocks from the old Missouri State Penitentiary. Our nostalgic, relaxed environment soothes your mind while enticing your senses with a diverse food menu and large selection of handcrafted ales. The large outdoor patio and bocce courts provide a great way to enjoy a beautiful Missouri day. Break out of the ordinary and escape to Prison Brews!

name: Quaff Bros
description: Quaff Bros. is the gypsy beer label owned and operated by the Party Source in Bellevue, Ky. It allows local breweries to showcase their talent through barrel aging projects.

name: Red Eye Brewing Company
description: Our craft beers are produced in small batches, by experienced brewers, using only the highest quality ingredients. Our brewers view these beers as a painter would his "palette", through which they manipulate grain, hops, yeast, and brewing techniques. We also encourage our brewers to add a little of their own creative flair.

name: RedDot BrewHouse
description:
RedDot BrewHouse at Dempsey is a passion that took almost a decade to materialize. Housing a brewery in a historical building that was rich in military history and set in lush tranquility was simply irresistible. An old dilapidated barrack was restored to what you see today with some of the original bricks that were 100 odd years old. 

In 2010, we found another beautiful historical building at Boat Quay, south bank of the Singapore River mouth, a river that was the source of entrepot trade and life in early Singapore. The second RedDot BrewHouse now offers our signature beers from a row of old Chinese shop houses which is rich in commercial history of our early Chinese settlers.

Beers, an age old historical beverage, to be enjoyed in age old historical buildings like Dempsey’s Tanglin Barracks (1860) and Boat Quay’s old commercial Chinese shop houses (1826). RedDot Beers, housed in rich history, rich in taste. Cheers!

name: Rifle Brewing Company
description: All of our microbrews are brewed on premise with the highest quality of craftmanship. We offer four core brews year round.  Our brewer is constantly switching up our selection so make sure to come in often for his newest creation.  You'll leave happy every time - guaranteed.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Monday thru Thursday: 5 PM - 9 PM
Friday thru Saturday: 5 PM - 9:30 PM

name: Riverport Brewing Company
description:
Riverport Brewing Company will put the flavor back in your beer. Even though your first experience with beer probably wasn't as pleasurable as the hype made it sound—you persevered and learned to enjoy it anyway. The American beer industry has spent years and countless dollars on advertising trying to persuade us how our beer should taste. Now we invite you to find out what beer was meant to taste like. Using only the finest grains, hops, and water we are sure that once you’ve tasted our fresh craft beer you’ll discover beer all over again!

Riverport Brewing Company is nestled beneath the grain-rich rolling hills of the Palouse in Clarkston, Washington, near the confluence of Idaho's Clearwater River and the mighty Snake River.

name: Rocks Brewing Company
description:
We are an Australian-owned and operated brewery lead by fifth and sixth generation convict descendants. Our craft beers will bring to life the true stories of early Australian convicts and settlers, beginning with traditional, great tasting ales - just like your grandfathers’ grandfather drank.

Rocks Brewing Co beers will amaze beer lovers with their complex and sophisticated flavours, which are achieved while staying true to our simple brewing process -
“Nothing but Barley, Hops, Water & Yeast.”

Our first batch of Red Ale was brewed September 2008. Since then we have created plenty of other beers, along with a cider.

Rocks beers are currently available on tap in selected pubs and restaurants as well as in bottles at good craft beer retailers. Keep an eye out for our distinctive logos on the taps and in the fridges of all good drinking establishments, we're bound to be there.

name: Rocky Point Artisan Ales
description: Brewing artisanal lagers and ales in Rocky Point, Long Island.

name: Run of the Mill Public House and Brewery
description:
The Run of the Mill Public House & Brewery is a 14 barrel brew pub specializing in hand-crafted beer and casual pub fare. All of our beers flow directly from our brewery.  We use only the finest imported malts and domestic hops available to bring you the tastiest and finest selection of beers.

Owner Geoff Houghton renovated an abandoned Mill and made it a place where business men and women meet, families gather and friends hang out.

In addition to our house-made beers, we have an eclectic Pub menu featuring home made food. Our talented chefs serve delightful appetizers, wraps, sandwiches, vegetarian fare, hearty entrees and imaginative daily specials.  Come in make yourself at home and enjoy a fresh brew and meal.
We are located on Saco Island in Saco Maine.  From Memorial Day to Labor Day come enjoy our outdoor seating and bar overlooking the Saco River, we offer a grill menu and raw bar.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Dining
Sun - Thurs: 11:30 - 9:00 pm
Fri - Sat:  11:30 - 10:00 pm  
       
Bar
Mon - Sun: 11:30 - 1:00 am

locations.name: Main Brewery

(book in advance)
Monday – Thursday
7pm – 8.30pm

Saturdays
1pm – 2.30pm
3pm – 4.30pm

name: Schram Vineyards Winery & Brewery
description: Minnesota's First Winery & Brewery!  Family-run business created award-winning wine and small batch custom brews in a beautiful vineyard setting in Waconia, MN.  Experience flagship and unique style brews by the flight or pint in the brand new modern rustic tap room overlooking a lake and vineyard.

name: South County Brewing Company
description:
South County Brewing Co. is located in beautiful southern York county PA. 
Brewing handcrafted Ales and lagers on a production system with an onsite taproom for retail sales.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Tue - Fri:	5:30 pm - 8:00 pm
Sat:	11:00 am - 3:00 pm

name: Southern Star Brewing Company
description:
Located in Conroe, Texas, Southern Star Brewing Company will provide Texans(and others) new craft beers to enjoy from our 10,000 square foot warehouse. 

Production began in March of 2008 with our signature beer of Pine Belt Pale Ale which is in our distinctive 16oz can or in kegs. This has now expanded to include Bombshell Blonde(12oz cans) and Buried Hatchet Stout(12oz cans), but both are also kegged. These will just be a few of the ales we will be offering as we expand into seasonal batches, plus we just started our PRO-AM line of brews where home brewers can compete to have their recipe produced at our brewery(with the help of the creators if they desire). The winning entry will also be entered into the GABF. 

Thanks to the help of our five distributors, we are able to get our brews to a variety of locations(including grocery stores, beverage shops, pubs and restaurants) throughout Texas and a few other states including Alabama, Florida, Indiana, Kentucky, Ohio, and South Carolina. Unfortunately due to laws in Texas we can't tell you where you can buy our beers, but we are working at trying to get them to as many of your favorite craft beer establishments as possible.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: We hold tours every Saturday at 1pm

name: Stone & Wood
description:
We established Stone & Wood Brewing Company in Byron Bay in 2008 after many years of working in the beer business. Our dream was to quit ‘working for the man’, shed the corporate garbage and get back to basics.

As the original brewers of Byron Bay we built our brewery here at the eastern tip of Australia, in a part of the world where people enjoy having a beer when relaxing after catching a wave, catching a band at the pub or just catching up with friends. It’s that sort of place.

We brew beer for times like these, beers that the locals, and the growing number of craft beer drinkers around the country, and of course ourselves, would find simply good to drink.

There’s a lot to love about Byron Bay … the beaches … the music … the people … the pubs. These are just a few of the reasons why we brew and bottle our beer in one of the greatest places on earth. This little town in Northern New South Wales has influenced everything we do at Stone & Wood.

Not only has it helped shape our philosophy of trying to take things slowly and keeping it simple, but the natural beauty, on the edge of the Pacific Ocean, and the laid back vibe were the inspiration for our beers.

‘Byron’ is a destination for visitors from around the world and we’re always grateful we get to call the place home.

name: Sun King Brewing Company
description:
Sun King Brewing Company is an Indianapolis-based craft brewery with a focus on continually creating traditional seasonal and unique specialty beers. 

Sun King rolled its first keg of beer out the door in July 2009 and since that time has grown into the second largest brewery in Indiana, producing over 21,000 barrels of beer in 2013. Sun King's beers have been awarded multiple medals at the Great American Beer Festival and World Beer Cup.

Located in a downtown Indianapolis warehouse, Sun King was the first full-scale production brewery in Indianapolis since 1948. Sun King beer can be enjoyed at fine bars/restaurants and liquor stores throughout Indiana or in their Tasting Room, located in the brewery at 135 N. College Avenue.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Retail Hours (Carry-out Only)
Tuesday - Noon - 6
Wednesday - Noon - 6
Thursday - Noon - 4

Tasting Hours  (Carry-out and Sampling)
Thursday - 4 - 7
Friday - 12 - 7
Saturday 1 - 4

name: Swamp Head Brewery
description:
Founded in 2008, upon the foundation of our great state, we raised our roof to brew world-class beers and establish ourselves as Florida’s brewery. Having travelled through lands far and close, and finding inspiration along the way, we are proud to be here, proud to be Inherently Floridian.

It has been our mission since day one to be Florida's brewery. We love our neighbors, but we're focused on providing our state with the beer it deserves.

That's only a small part of it.

Have a look around, from our brewery, to our logo and branding, to our beer, you can see that we live, love and are Florida. From now until the horizon, Swamp Head Brewery is Inherently Floridian.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Wednesday, Thursday, Friday: 4pm to 8pm

name: TG Enterprises, Inc
description:
Just Who Are "Those Guys"?

"Those Guys" represent the anonymous many among us all. Those guys built our bridges and our skyscrapers. Those guys built the roads we travel on, the airplanes we fly in, the cars we drive, and the houses we live in. Those guys serve their country, protect our children, put out our fires, and collect our trash. Those guys work in our offices, teach in our schools, raise our food, and serve us in restaurants.

Reaching stores in 2010, Those Guys Beer, an all-natural, all-malt lager, brewed and bottled in the U.S.A. is now available to all 'Those Guys.'

name: The Bruery
description:
A boutique craft brewery located in Orange County, California specializing in experimental and barrel aged beer. Our name is a fusion of 'brewery' with our family name, Rue.

Our calling is to create beers with character and depth using the simplest and purest of means. We do not filter or pasteurize our beers. Most of our bottled beers gain carbonation through bottle conditioning, allowing carbonation to naturally occur through a secondary bottle fermentation. We strive to use unconventional ingredients, and we will proudly state what we put in our beers.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Friday & Saturday: 4pm - 10pm
Sunday: 12pm - 6pm

name: Thistly Cross Cider
description:
Born out of a passion for making cider in the best possible way, combined with belief in the quality of Scottish produce, and asking ‘why not?’, came Thistly Cross Cider; Scotland’s award winning farmhouse ciders. Established as a collaboration between farmer, Ian Rennie, and artist-turned-cidermaker, Peter Stuart, in 2008, Thistly Cross has gained a reputation for making ciders that people rave about.

Based at the Cider Shed on South Belton Farm, in the heart of the East Lothian countryside, we’re involved in every aspect of making our award-winning Scottish farmhouse cider. From pressing the Scottish apples and strawberries, to achieving the smooth, balanced Thistly Cross flavour by fermenting with Champagne yeast then maturing for six months; we’re invested at every step of the cider-making process, from apple to cider.

name: Upslope Brewing Company
description:
Located in Boulder with two tap rooms (Flatiron Park & Lee Hill), Upslope taps into Colorado's active lifestyle by offering superior quality, hand-crafted ales & lagers in cans for the on-the-go beer enthusiast.

Ascend to New Heights.

name: Vallensons Brewing Company
description:
Vallensons Brewery

Our small home brewery located in Pearland Texas just South of Houston was founded in December 2008. We have been brewing great beers for over 14 years and one day aspire to have our own Nanobrewery. Since any start-up is always tough, we feel starting small and expanding later is the best way to go. 

As a Nanobrewery we brew 1/2  barrel of beer at a time which means we can afford to brew different styles of beer in smaller quantities (less cost) while focusing attention to traditional styles with a creative twist. At Vallensons we like to experiment and thus far our beers have been very successful. 

Vallensons plans to be different then the standard brewery by carving a niche out of the craft brewing industry. Vallensons Brewing Company plans to build its reputation on quality, character and consistency and the best part of it all is that we plan on having fun along the way. We believe that if you put passion into what you love then you will yield success.

name: Vertigo Brewing
description:
The early seeds of Vertigo Brewing were sown back in 1995 when Mike Haines and Mike Kinion began experimenting with brewing at U-Brew in Tigard, Oregon. But what began as a light hobby soon developed into a deep passion. They quickly outgrew the offerings of U-Brew and expanded their operation into a homebrew setup. Fifteen years later, the two Mikes have a lot of batches, awards, and experience under their belts. Starting in May of 2008, Vertigo Brewing was christened a fully-licensed brewery in a Hillsboro warehouse. 
Vertigo Brewing is currently operating a one barrel system, producing eight to ten barrels a month. But as demand takes off, the two Mikes are eagerly looking forward to an expanded business operation. Vertigo prides itself on producing a unique blend of beer offerings that manage to stand out in the beer-saturated market of the Northwest.

name: Wallace Brewing Company
description:
Wallace Brewing Company, 15-barrel microbrewery, began selling its beer in January 2009, in historic Wallace, Idaho.

A collaborative effort of Wallace’s Chase Sanborn, Dean Cooper, Rick Magnuson and the Zanettis, the brewery pays homage to the town’s notorious past, creating a brand of beers with mining and bordello-inspired monikers such as ‘Dirty Blonde’, ‘Jackleg Stout’, ‘RedLight Irish Red Ale’, and ‘Idaho Select Light Lager’ .

“We want to brew in the honest spirit of the mining heritage,” General Manager, Chase Sanborn said. “It’s not only the prevailing reputation of the town, but also one that can elevate the Wallace Brewing brand.

name: Waterway Brewing Company
description: Great People! Great Fun! Great Beer! Private, exclusive brewpub. Not open to the general public. Admission only to members and their guests. Membership by invitation only. No exceptions, ever. Trespassers will be shot. Survivors will be shot again.

name: Yak & Yeti Brewpub
description:
The Yak and Yeti Brewpub is located in Olde Town Arvada and resides in an 1864 haunted Victorian brick mansion. Our 7 barrel brewhouse can be seen from the lobby near the bar. 

All our beers are handcrafted by our brewmaster, Adam Draeger. Seasonals beers are released monthly and sometimes weekly. Stop by for pint of craft beer or take home a growler today.
